import os
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create output directory
output_dir = "portfolio_visuals"
os.makedirs(output_dir, exist_ok=True)

# Define portfolio data
portfolios = {
    "Conservative": {
        "allocation": {"Bonds": 70, "Equities": 25, "Cash": 5},
        "expected_return": 4.2,
        "volatility": 3.1,
        "color": "#4CAF50"
    },
    "Balanced": {
        "allocation": {"Equities": 50, "Bonds": 40, "Alternatives": 10},
        "expected_return": 6.5,
        "volatility": 7.0,
        "color": "#2196F3"
    },
    "Aggressive": {
        "allocation": {"Equities": 85, "Alternatives": 10, "Cash": 5},
        "expected_return": 9.8,
        "volatility": 14.5,
        "color": "#F44336"
    },
    "Thematic": {
        "allocation": {"Tech Innovation": 60, "Green Energy": 20, "Healthcare": 20},
        "expected_return": 8.0,
        "volatility": 10.2,
        "color": "#9C27B0"
    },
    "Alternative": {
        "allocation": {"Real Estate": 40, "Commodities": 30, "Private Equity": 30},
        "expected_return": 7.2,
        "volatility": 8.5,
        "color": "#FF9800"
    }
}

# Generate mock 10-year performance data
years = np.arange(2014, 2024)
np.random.seed(42)

def generate_performance(base_return, volatility):
    """Simulate 10-year cumulative performance."""
    annual_returns = np.random.normal(base_return / 100, volatility / 100, len(years))
    cumulative = np.cumprod(1 + annual_returns)
    return cumulative / cumulative[0] * 100  # normalize to 100 start

# Generate visuals for each portfolio
for name, data in portfolios.items():
    alloc = data["allocation"]
    color = data["color"]

    # --- Pie Chart: Asset Allocation ---
    plt.figure(figsize=(5, 5))
    plt.pie(alloc.values(), labels=alloc.keys(), autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90)
    plt.title(f"{name} Portfolio - Asset Allocation")
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig(os.path.join(output_dir, f"{name.lower()}_allocation.png"))
    plt.close()

    # --- Line Chart: 10-Year Performance ---
    performance = generate_performance(data["expected_return"], data["volatility"])
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 4))
    plt.plot(years, performance, color=color, linewidth=2)
    plt.title(f"{name} Portfolio - 10-Year Performance (Simulated)")
    plt.xlabel("Year")
    plt.ylabel("Portfolio Value (Index = 100)")
    plt.grid(True, linestyle="--", alpha=0.6)
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig(os.path.join(output_dir, f"{name.lower()}_performance.png"))
    plt.close()

    # --- Bar Chart: Return vs. Volatility ---
    plt.figure(figsize=(4, 4))
    plt.bar(["Expected Return", "Volatility"], [data["expected_return"], data["volatility"]], color=color)
    plt.title(f"{name} Portfolio - Return vs. Volatility")
    plt.ylabel("Percentage (%)")
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig(os.path.join(output_dir, f"{name.lower()}_risk_return.png"))
    plt.close()

print(f"Portfolio visuals saved in '{output_dir}/' directory.")

        plt.close()
